text: Cell - specific differences in activation of NF-kappa B regulatory elements of human immunodeficiency virus and beta interferon promoters by <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Three aspects of the involvement of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) pathogenesis were examined .

<extra_id_0> Tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) mRNA production was analyzed by polymerase chain reaction amplification in monocytic U937 cells and in a chronically HIV infected U937 cell line ( U9-IIIB ) .
<extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA was undetectable in U937 cells , whereas a low constitutive level was detected in U9-IIIB cells .

text: Paramyxovirus infection induced a 5 - to 10-fold increase in the steady-state level of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in U9-IIIB cells compared with U937 cells , suggesting that HIV-infected monocytic cells produced higher levels of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> than did normal cells after a secondary virus infection .

text: The effects of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on gene expression were examined by transient expression assays using reporter <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plasmids linked to regulatory elements from the HIV long terminal repeat ( LTR ) and the <extra_id_0> beta interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

In U937 and Jurkat T lymphoid cells , the inducibility of the different hybrid promoters by <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or phorbol ester varied in a cell type - and promoter context - specific manner ; the levels of gene activity of NF-kappa B - containing plasmids correlated directly with induction of NF-kappa B DNA - binding activity .

Although the intact <extra_id_0> beta interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter was only weakly stimulated by phorbol ester or <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , multimers of the PRDII NF-kappa B - binding domain were inducible by both agents .

text: <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was able to increase expression of the HIV LTR in T cells , but in monocytic cells , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not induce the HIV LTR above a constitutive level of activity .

This level of NF-kappa B - independent activity appears to be sufficient for virus multiplication , since <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment had no effect on the kinetics of de novo HIV type 1 ( HIV-1 ) infection and viral RNA production in U937 cells .

However , in Jurkat cells , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dramatically enhanced the spread of HIV-1 through the cell population and increased viral RNA synthesis , indicating that in T cells HIV-1 multiplication was stimulated by <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment .
